param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns the account details for the {AccountSid}.

property.name: Account
property.property: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this account.
The date that this account was created, given as GMT in RFC 2822 format.
The date that this account was last updated, given in as GMT in RFC 2822 format.
A human readable description of this account, up to 64 characters long. By default the FriendlyName is your email address.
The status of this account. Usually active, but can be suspended if you've been bad.
The authorization token for this account. This token should be kept a secret, so no sharing.
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com
The list of subresources under this account

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account

param.name: FriendlyName
param.notes: The human-readable description of an account.

method.notes: Allows you to modify the 'FriendlyName' for the {AccountSid}.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Right now, your credentials are tied to one and only one account, so the list resource only contains your single account.

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account.

param.name: From
param.notes: A Twilio number enabled for SMS. Only phone numbers purchased from Twilio work here; you cannot (for example) spoof SMS messages from your own cell phone number.

param.name: To
param.notes: The number to call. Format with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format). Twilio will also accept unformatted US numbers e.g., (415) 555-1212, 415-555-1212.

param.name: Body
param.notes: The text of the message you want to send, limited to 160 characters.

param.name: StatusCallback
param.notes: A URL that Twilio will POST to when your message is processed. Twilio will POST the SmsSid as well as SmsStatus=sent or SmsStatus=failed.

method.name: POST
method.notes: Send a new outgoing message.

property.name: SMSMessage
property.property: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this resource
The date that this resource was created, given in RFC 2822 format
The date that this resource was last updated, given in RFC 2822 format
The date that the SMS was sent, given in RFC 2822 format.
The unique id of the Account that sent this SMS message.
The phone number that initiated the message in E.164 format. For incoming messages, this will be the remote phone. For outgoing messages, this will be one of your Twilio phone numbers.
The phone number that received the message in E.164 format. For incoming messages, this will be one of your Twilio phone numbers. For outgoing messages, this will be the remote phone.
The text body of the SMS message. Up to 160 characters long
The status of this SMS message. Either queued, sending, sent, or failed

The direction of this SMS message. incoming for incoming messages, outbound-api for messages initiated via the REST API, outbound-call for messages initiated during a call or outbound-reply for messages initiated in response to an incoming SMS.
The amount billed for the message
The version of the Twilio API used to process the SMS message
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account

param.name: From
param.notes: Only show SMS messages from this phone number

param.name: To
param.notes: Only show SMS messages to this phone number.

param.name: DateSent
param.notes: Only show SMS messages sent on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD. Example: DateSent=2009-07-06. You can also specify inequality, such as DateSent lt YYYY-MM-DD for SMS messages that were sent on or before midnight on a date, and DateSent gt YYYY-MM-DD for SMS messages sent on or after midnight on a date.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns a list of SMS messages associated with your account identified by {AccountSid}.

property.name: SMSMessage
property.property: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this resource
The date that this resource was created, given in RFC 2822 format
The date that this resource was last updated, given in RFC 2822 format
The date that the SMS was sent, given in RFC 2822 format
The unique id of the Account that sent this SMS message
The phone number that initiated the message in E.164 format. For incoming messages, this will be the remote phone. For outgoing messages, this will be one of your Twilio phone numbers.
The phone number that received the message in E.164 format. For incoming messages, this will be one of your Twilio phone numbers. For outgoing messages, this will be the remote phone.
The text body of the SMS message. Up to 160 characters long
The status of this SMS message. Either queued, sending, sent, or failed

The direction of this SMS message. incoming for incoming messages, outbound-api for messages initiated via the REST API, outbound-call for messages initiated during a call or outbound-reply for messages initiated in response to an incoming SMS.
The amount billed for the message
The version of the Twilio API used to process the SMS message
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account

param.name: SMSMessageSid
param.notes: Represents a 34 character string that uniquely identifies this SMSMessage

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: PhoneNumber
param.notes: Only show the caller id resource that exactly matches this phone number.

param.name: FriendlyName
param.notes: Only show the caller id resource that exactly matches this name.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns the list of outgoing caller ids for this account

property.name: OutgoingCallerId
property.property: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this caller id
The date that this resource was created, given in RFC 2822 format
The date that this resource was last updated, given in RFC 2822 format
A human readable descriptive text for this resource, up to 64 characters long which by default is a nicely formatted version of the phone number
The unique id of the Account responsible for this caller id
The incoming phone number. Formatted with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format)
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: PhoneNumber
param.notes: The phone number to verify. Should be formatted with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format). Twilio will also accept unformatted US numbers e.g., (415) 555-1212, 415-555-1212.

param.name: FriendlyName
param.notes: A human readable description for the new caller ID with maximum length 64 characters. Defaults to a nicely formatted version of the number.

param.name: CallDelay
param.notes: The number of seconds, between 0 and 60, to delay before initiating the validation call. Defaults to 0.

method.name: POST
method.notes: Adds a new caller id to your account

property.name: ValidationRequest
property.property: The unique id of the Account to which the Validation Request belongs.
The incoming phone number being validated, formatted with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format).
The friendly name you provided, if any.
The 6 digit validation code that must be entered via the phone to validate this phone number for Caller ID.

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

method.name: DELETE
method.notes: Deletes the outgoing caller id specified by the provided {OutgoingCallerIdSid}

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: IsoCountryCode
param.notes: The ISO country code of this phone number

param.name: AreaCode
param.notes: Find phone numbers in the specified Area Code. Only available for North American numbers.

param.name: Contains
param.notes: A pattern to match phone numbers on. Valid characters are '*' and [0-9a-zA-Z]. The '*' character will match any single digit.

param.name: InRegion
param.notes: Limit results to a particular region (i.e. State/Province). Given a phone number, search within the same Region as that number.

param.name: InPostalCode
param.notes: Limit results to a particular postal code. Given a phone number, search within the same postal code as that number.

param.name: NearLatLong
param.notes: Given a latitude/longitude pair lat,long find geographically close numbers within Distance miles.

param.name: NearNumber
param.notes: Given a phone number, find a geographically close number within Distance miles. Distance defaults to 25 miles.

param.name: InLata
param.notes: Limit results to a specific Local access and transport area (LATA). Given a phone number, search within the same LATA as that number.

param.name: InRateCenter
param.notes: Limit results to a specific rate center, or given a phone number search within the same rate center as that number. Requires InLata to be set as well.

param.name: Distance
param.notes: Specifies the search radius for a Near- query in miles. If not specified this defaults to 25 miles.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns a list of local AvailablePhoneNumber resource representations, each representing a phone number that is currently available for provisioning within your account.

property.name: AvailablePhoneNumber
property.property: A nicely-formatted version of the phone number.
The phone number, in E.164 format.
The LATA of this phone number.
The rate center of this phone number.
The latitude coordinate of this phone number.
The longitude coordinate of this phone number.
The two-letter state or province abbreviation of this phone numbe
The postal (zip) code of this phone number.
The ISO country code of this phone number.

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: IsoCountryCode
param.notes: The ISO country code of this phone number

param.name: Contains
param.notes: A pattern to match phone numbers on. Valid characters are '*' and [0-9a-zA-Z]. The '*' character will match any single digit.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns a list of toll-free AvailablePhoneNumber resource representations, each representing a phone number that is currently available for provisioning within your account.

property.name: AvailablePhoneNumber
property.property: A nicely-formatted version of the phone number.
The phone number, in E.164 (i.e. "+1") format.
The ISO country code of this phone number.

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: CallSid
param.notes: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns the single Call resource identified by {CallSid}.

property.name: Call
property.property: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.
A 34 character string that uniquely identifies the call that created this leg.
The date that this resource was created, given as GMT RFC 2822 format.
The date that this resource was last updated, given as GMT RFC 2822 format.
The unique id of the Account responsible for this phone number.
The phone number that received this call.
The phone number that made this call.
If the call was inbound, this is the Sid of the IncomingPhoneNumber that received the call. If the call was outbound, it is the Sid of the OutgoingCallerId from which the call was placed.
A string representing the status of the call. May be queued, ringing, in-progress, completed, failed, busy or no-answer.
The start time of the call, given as GMT in RFC 2822 format. Empty if the call has not yet been dialed.
The end time of the call, given as GMT in RFC 2822 format. Empty if the call did not complete successfully.
The length of the call in seconds. This value is empty for busy, failed, unanswered or ongoing calls.
The charge for this call in USD. Populated after the call is completed. May not be immediately available.
A string describing the direction of the call. inbound for inbound calls, outbound-api for calls initiated via the REST API or outbound-dial for calls initiated by a "Dial" verb.
If this call was initiated with answering machine detection, either human or machine. Empty otherwise.
If this call was an incoming call forwarded from another number, the forwarding phone number (depends on carrier supporting forwarding). Empty otherwise.
If this call was an incoming call from a phone number with Caller ID Lookup enabled, the caller's name. Empty otherwise.
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: CallSid
param.notes: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource

param.name: Url
param.notes: A valid URL that returns TwiML. Twilio will immediately redirect the call to the new TwiML.

param.name: Method
param.notes: The HTTP method Twilio should use when requesting the above URL. Defaults to POST.

param.name: Status
param.notes: Either canceled or completed. Specifying canceled will attempt to hangup calls that are queued or ringing but not affect calls already in progress. Specifying completed will attempt to hang up a call even if it's already in progress.

method.name: POST
method.notes: Modifies a live call. Modification could be redirection or termination of the call.

property.name: Call
property.property: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.
A 34 character string that uniquely identifies the call that created this leg.
The date that this resource was created, given as GMT RFC 2822 format.
The date that this resource was last updated, given as GMT RFC 2822 format.
The unique id of the Account responsible for this phone number.
The phone number that received this call.
The phone number that made this call.
If the call was inbound, this is the Sid of the IncomingPhoneNumber that received the call. If the call was outbound, it is the Sid of the OutgoingCallerId from which the call was placed.
A string representing the status of the call. May be queued, ringing, in-progress, completed, failed, busy or no-answer.
The start time of the call, given as GMT in RFC 2822 format. Empty if the call has not yet been dialed.
The end time of the call, given as GMT in RFC 2822 format. Empty if the call did not complete successfully.
The length of the call in seconds. This value is empty for busy, failed, unanswered or ongoing calls.
The charge for this call in USD. Populated after the call is completed. May not be immediately available.
A string describing the direction of the call. inbound for inbound calls, outbound-api for calls initiated via the REST API or outbound-dial for calls initiated by a "Dial" verb.
If this call was initiated with answering machine detection, either human or machine. Empty otherwise.
If this call was an incoming call forwarded from another number, the forwarding phone number (depends on carrier supporting forwarding). Empty otherwise.
If this call was an incoming call from a phone number with Caller ID Lookup enabled, the caller's name. Empty otherwise.
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: To
param.notes: Only show calls to this phone number.

param.name: From
param.notes: Only show calls from this phone number.

param.name: Status
param.notes: Only show calls currently in this status. May be queued, ringing, in-progress, completed, failed, busy, or no-answer.

param.name: StartTime
param.notes: Only show calls that started on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD. Also supports inequalities, such as StartTime(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for calls that started at or before midnight on a date, and StartTime(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for calls that started at or after midnight on a date.

param.name: EndTime
param.notes: Only show calls that ended on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD. Also supoprts inequalities, such as EndTime(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for calls that ended at or before midnight on a date, and EndTime(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for calls that end at or after midnight on a date.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns a list of phone calls made to and from the account identified by {AccountSid}, sorted by DateUpdated with most-recent calls first.

property.name: Call
property.property: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.
A 34 character string that uniquely identifies the call that created this leg.
The date that this resource was created, given as GMT RFC 2822 format.
The date that this resource was last updated, given as GMT RFC 2822 format.
The unique id of the Account responsible for this phone number.
The phone number that received this call.
The phone number that made this call.
If the call was inbound, this is the Sid of the IncomingPhoneNumber that received the call. If the call was outbound, it is the Sid of the OutgoingCallerId from which the call was placed.
A string representing the status of the call. May be queued, ringing, in-progress, completed, failed, busy or no-answer.
The start time of the call, given as GMT in RFC 2822 format. Empty if the call has not yet been dialed.
The end time of the call, given as GMT in RFC 2822 format. Empty if the call did not complete successfully.
The length of the call in seconds. This value is empty for busy, failed, unanswered or ongoing calls.
The charge for this call in USD. Populated after the call is completed. May not be immediately available.
A string describing the direction of the call. inbound for inbound calls, outbound-api for calls initiated via the REST API or outbound-dial for calls initiated by a "Dial" verb.
If this call was initiated with answering machine detection, either human or machine. Empty otherwise.
If this call was an incoming call forwarded from another number, the forwarding phone number (depends on carrier supporting forwarding). Empty otherwise.
If this call was an incoming call from a phone number with Caller ID Lookup enabled, the caller's name. Empty otherwise.
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: From
param.notes: The phone number to use as the caller id. Format with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format). Must be a Twilio number or a valid outgoing caller id for your account.

param.name: To
param.notes: The number to call formatted with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format). Twilio will also accept unformatted US numbers e.g., (415) 555-1212, 415-555-1212.

param.name: Url
param.notes: The fully qualified URL that should be consulted when the call connects. Just like when you set a URL for your inbound calls.

param.name: Method
param.notes: The HTTP method Twilio should use when requesting the required Url parameter's value above. Defaults to POST.

param.name: FallbackUrl
param.notes: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML at Url.

param.name: FallbackMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method that Twilio should use to request the FallbackUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: StatusCallback
param.notes: A URL that Twilio will request when the call ends to notify your app.

param.name: StatusCallbackMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method Twilio should use when requesting the above URL. Defaults to POST.

param.name: SendDigits
param.notes: A string of keys to dial after connecting to the number. Valid digits in the string include: any digit (0-9), '#' and '*'. For example, if you connected to a company phone number, and wanted to dial extension 1234 and then the pound key, use SendDigits=1234#. Remember to URL-encode this string, since the '#' character has special meaning in a URL.

param.name: IfMachine
param.notes: Tell Twilio to try and determine if a machine (like voicemail) or a human has answered the call. Possible values are Continue and Hangup. See the answering machines section below for more info.

param.name: Timeout
param.notes: The integer number of seconds that Twilio should allow the phone to ring before assuming there is no answer. Default is 60 seconds, the maximum is 999 seconds. Note, you could set this to a low value, such as 15, to hangup before reaching an answering machine or voicemail. Also see the answering machine section for other solutions.

method.name: POST
method.notes: Make a call.

property.name: Call
property.property: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.
A 34 character string that uniquely identifies the call that created this leg.
The date that this resource was created, given as GMT RFC 2822 format.
The date that this resource was last updated, given as GMT RFC 2822 format.
The unique id of the Account responsible for this phone number.
The phone number that received this call.
The phone number that made this call.
If the call was inbound, this is the Sid of the IncomingPhoneNumber that received the call. If the call was outbound, it is the Sid of the OutgoingCallerId from which the call was placed.
A string representing the status of the call. May be queued, ringing, in-progress, completed, failed, busy or no-answer.
The start time of the call, given as GMT in RFC 2822 format. Empty if the call has not yet been dialed.
The end time of the call, given as GMT in RFC 2822 format. Empty if the call did not complete successfully.
The length of the call in seconds. This value is empty for busy, failed, unanswered or ongoing calls.
The charge for this call in USD. Populated after the call is completed. May not be immediately available.
A string describing the direction of the call. inbound for inbound calls, outbound-api for calls initiated via the REST API or outbound-dial for calls initiated by a "Dial" verb.
If this call was initiated with answering machine detection, either human or machine. Empty otherwise.
If this call was an incoming call forwarded from another number, the forwarding phone number (depends on carrier supporting forwarding). Empty otherwise.
If this call was an incoming call from a phone number with Caller ID Lookup enabled, the caller's name. Empty otherwise.
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com
The list of subresources under this resource.

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

param.name: IncomingPhoneNumberSid
param.notes: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Fetches the details of a phone number purchased from Twilio

property.name: IncomingPhoneNumber
property.property: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.
The date that this resource was created, given as GMT RFC 2822 format.
The date that this resource was last updated, given as GMT RFC 2822 format.
A human readable descriptive text for this resource, up to 64 characters long. By default, the FriendlyName is a nicely formatted version of the phone number.
The unique id of the Account responsible for this phone number.
The incoming phone number. e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format)
Calls to this phone number will start a new TwiML session with this API version.
Look up the caller's caller-ID name from the CNAM database (additional charges apply). Either true or false.
The URL Twilio will request when this phone number receives a call.
The HTTP method Twilio will use when requesting the above Url. Either GET or POST.
The URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs retrieving or executing the TwiML requested by Url.
The HTTP method Twilio will use when requesting the VoiceFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST.
The URL that Twilio will request to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.
The HTTP method Twilio will use to make requests to the StatusCallback URL. Either GET or POST.
The URL Twilio will request when receiving an incoming SMS message to this number.
The HTTP method Twilio will use when making requests to the SmsUrl. Either GET or POST.
The URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs retrieving or executing the TwiML from SmsUrl.
The HTTP method Twilio will use when requesting the above URL. Either GET or POST.
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com.

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

param.name: IncomingPhoneNumberSid
param.notes: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.

param.name: FriendlyName
param.notes: A human readable description of the new incoming phone number resource, with maximum length 64 characters.

param.name: ApiVersion
param.notes: Calls to this phone number will start a new TwiML session with this API version. Either 2010-04-01 or 2008-08-01.

param.name: VoiceUrl
param.notes: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody dials the phone number.

param.name: VoiceMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: VoiceFallbackUrl
param.notes: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by VoiceUrl.

param.name: VoiceFallbackMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: StatusCallback
param.notes: The URL that Twilio will request to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

param.name: StatusCallbackMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method Twilio will use to make requests to the StatusCallback URL. Either GET or POST.

param.name: SmsUrl
param.notes: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the new phone number.

param.name: SmsMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: SmsFallbackUrl
param.notes: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by SmsUrl.

param.name: SmsFallbackMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: VoiceCallerIdLookup
param.notes: Do a lookup of a caller's name from the CNAM database and post it to your app. Either true or false. Defaults to false.

method.name: POST
method.notes: Update an incoming phone number obtained from Twilio.

property.property: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.

A human readable descriptive text for this resource, up to 64 characters long. By default, the FriendlyName is a nicely formatted version of the phone number.
The unique id of the Account responsible for this phone number.

Calls to this phone number will start a new TwiML session with this API version.

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

param.name: PhoneNumber
param.notes: The phone number you want to purchase. The number should be formated starting with a '+' followed by the country code and the number in E.164 format

param.name: FriendlyName
param.notes: A human readable description of the new incoming phone number. Maximum 64 characters. Defaults to a formatted version of the number.

param.name: VoiceUrl
param.notes: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody dials the new phone number.

param.name: VoiceMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: VoiceFallbackUrl
param.notes: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML at Url.

param.name: VoiceFallbackMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: StatusCallback
param.notes: The URL that Twilio will request to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

param.name: StatusCallbackMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method Twilio will use to make requests to the StatusCallback URL. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: SmsUrl
param.notes: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the phone number.

param.name: SmsMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: SmsFallbackUrl
param.notes: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by SmsUrl.

param.name: SmsFallbackMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsFallbackUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: VoiceCallerIdLookup
param.notes: Do a lookup of a caller's name from the CNAM database and post it to your app. Either true or false. Defaults to false.

method.name: POST
method.notes: Adds a new phone number to your account. If a phone number is found for your request, Twilio will add it to your account

param.name: AreaCode
param.notes: The area code in which you'd like a new incoming phone number. Any three digit, US area code is valid. Twilio will provision a random phone number within this area code for you. You must include either this or a PhoneNumber parameter to have your POST succeed.

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: CallSid
param.notes: Show only recordings made during the call given by this sid.

param.name: DateCreated
param.notes: Only show recordings created on the given date. Should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such as DateCreated(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for recordings generated at or before midnight on a date, and DateCreated(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for recordings generated at or after midnight on a date.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns a recording list for the {CallSid}

property.name: Recording
property.property: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this resource.
The date that this resource was created, given in RFC 2822 format.
The date that this resource was last updated, given in RFC 2822 format.
The unique id of the Account responsible for this recording.
The call during which the recording was made.
The length of the recording, in seconds.
The version of the API in use during the recording.
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com

param.name: RecordingSid
param.notes: The unique id of the Recording this Transcription was made of

method.name: GET
method.notes: Each Recording instance resource has a Transcriptions subresource which represents the set of transcriptions generated from the recording (if any). Represents the set of transcriptions available for the recording identified by {RecordingSid}.

property.name: Transcription
property.property: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this resource.
The date that this resource was created, given in RFC 2822 format.
The date that this resource was last updated, given in RFC 2822 format.
The unique id of the Account responsible for this recording.
A string representing the status of the transcription: in-progress, completed or failed.
The unique id of the Recording this Transcription was made of.
The duration of the transcribed audio, in seconds.
The text content of the transcription.
The charge for this transcript in USD. Populated after the transcript is completed. Note, this value may not be immediately available.
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com

param.name: NotificationSid
param.notes: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this resource.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns a notification

property.name: Notification
property.property: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this resource.
The date that this resource was created, given in RFC 2822 format.
The date that this resource was last updated, given in RFC 2822 format.
The unique id of the Account responsible for this notification.
CallSid is the unique id of the call during which the notification was generated. Empty if the notification was generated by the REST API without regard to a specific phone call.
The version of the Twilio in use when this notification was generated.
An integer log level corresponding to the type of notification: 0 is ERROR, 1 is WARNING.
A unique error code for the error condition.
A URL for more information about the error condition.
The text of the notification.
The date the notification was actually generated, given in RFC 2822 format. Due to buffering, this may be slightly different than the DateCreated date.

The URL of the resource that generated the notification. If the notification was generated during a phone call: This is the URL of the resource on YOUR SERVER that caused the notification. If the notification was generated by your use of the REST API: This is the URL of the REST resource you were attempting to request on Twilio's servers.

The HTTP method in use for the request that generated the notification. If the notification was generated during a phone call: The HTTP Method use to request the resource on your server. If the notification was generated by your use of the REST API: This is the HTTP method used in your request to the REST resource on Twilio's servers.

The Twilio-generated HTTP GET or POST variables sent to your server. Alternatively, if the notification was generated by the REST API, this field will include any HTTP POST or PUT variables you sent to the REST API.
The HTTP headers returned by your server.
The HTTP body returned by your server.
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: NotificationSid
param.notes: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this resource.

method.name: DELETE
method.notes: Deletes a notification

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: Log
param.notes: Only show notifications for this log, using the integer log values shown above.

param.name: MessageDate
param.notes: Only show notifications for this date. Should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such as MessageDate(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for messages logged at or before midnight on a date, and MessageDate(greater than or equal to )YYYY-MM-DD for messages logged at or after midnight on a date. When performing a date range query with day-granularity make sure the right endpoint is midnight of the next day (e.g. to construct a range query for all calls on YYYY-MM-DD use MessageDate(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD(and)MessageDate(less than)YYYY-MM-(DD+1)).

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns a notification list

A unique error code for the error condition.
A URL for more information about the error condition.
The text of the notification.
The date the notification was actually generated, given in RFC 2822 format. Due to buffering, this may be slightly different than the DateCreated date.

The URL of the resource that generated the notification. If the notification was generated during a phone call: This is the URL of the resource on YOUR SERVER that caused the notification. If the notification was generated by your use of the REST API: This is the URL of the REST resource you were attempting to request on Twilio's servers.

The HTTP method in use for the request that generated the notification. If the notification was generated during a phone call: The HTTP Method use to request the resource on your server. If the notification was generated by your use of the REST API: This is the HTTP method used in your request to the REST resource on Twilio's servers.

The Twilio-generated HTTP GET or POST variables sent to your server. Alternatively, if the notification was generated by the REST API, this field will include any HTTP POST or PUT variables you sent to the REST API.
The HTTP headers returned by your server.
The HTTP body returned by your server.
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com

method.notes: Returns a representation of the conference identified by {ConferenceSid}.

property.name: Conference
property.property: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this conference.
A user provided string that identifies this conference room.
A string representing the status of the conference. May be init, in-progress, or completed.
The date that this conference was created, given as GMT in RFC 2822 format.
The date that this conference was last updated, given as GMT in RFC 2822 format.
The unique id of the Account responsible for creating this conference.
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: ConferenceSid
param.notes: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this conference.

param.name: Muted
param.notes: Only show participants that are muted or unmuted. Either true or false.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns the list of participants in the conference identified by {ConferenceSid}.

property.name: Participant
property.property: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies the call that is connected to this conference.
A 34 character string that identifies the conference this participant is in.
The date that this resource was created, given in RFC 2822 format.
The date that this resource was last updated, given in RFC 2822 format.
The unique id of the Account that created this conference.
true if this participant is currently muted. false otherwise.
Was the startConferenceOnEnter attribute set on this participant (true or false)?
Was the endConferenceOnExit attribute set on this participant (true or false)?
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: Status
param.notes: Only show conferences currently in with this status. May be init, in-progress, or completed.

param.name: FriendlyName
param.notes: List conferences who's FriendlyName is the exact match of this string.

param.name: DateCreated
param.notes: Only show conferences that started on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such as DateCreated(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that started at or before midnight on a date, and DateCreated(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that started at or after midnight on a date.

param.name: DateUpdated
param.notes: Only show conferences that were last updated on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such as DateUpdated(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that were last updated at or before midnight on a date, and DateUpdated(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that were updated at or after midnight on a date.

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns a list of conferences within an account identified by {AccountSid}.

The date that this conference was created, given as GMT in RFC 2822 format.
The date that this conference was last updated, given as GMT in RFC 2822 format.
The unique id of the Account responsible for creating this conference.
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com

method.name: GET
method.notes: Returns the Sandbox resource associated with the account identified by {AccountSid}.

property.name: TwilioSandbox
property.property: An 8 digit number that gives access to this sandbox.
The unique id of the Account connected to this sandbox.
The phone number of the sandbox. Formatted with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format).
The URL Twilio will request when the sandbox number is called.
The HTTP method to use when requesting the above URL. Either GET or POST.
The URL Twilio will request when receiving an incoming SMS message to the sandbox number.
The HTTP method to use when requesting the sms URL. Either GET or POST.
The date that this resource was created, given in RFC 2822 format.
The date that this resource was last updated, given in RFC 2822 format.
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: VoiceMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method that should be used to request the above URL. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: SmsUrl
param.notes: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the sandbox.

param.name: SmsMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

method.name: POST
method.notes: Updates the Sandbox resource via POST.

property.name: TwilioSandbox
property.property: An 8 digit number that gives access to this sandbox.
The unique id of the Account connected to this sandbox.
The phone number of the sandbox. Formatted with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format).
The URL Twilio will request when the sandbox number is called.
The HTTP method to use when requesting the above URL. Either GET or POST.
The URL Twilio will request when receiving an incoming SMS message to the sandbox number.
The HTTP method to use when requesting the sms URL. Either GET or POST.
The date that this resource was created, given in RFC 2822 format.
The date that this resource was last updated, given in RFC 2822 format.
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com

param.name: AccountSid
param.notes: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: VoiceMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method that should be used to request the above URL. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: SmsUrl
param.notes: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the sandbox.

param.name: SmsMethod
param.notes: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

method.name: PUT
method.notes: Updates the Sandbox resource via PUT.

property.name: TwilioSandbox
property.property: An 8 digit number that gives access to this sandbox.
The unique id of the Account connected to this sandbox.
The phone number of the sandbox. Formatted with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format).
The URL Twilio will request when the sandbox number is called.
The HTTP method to use when requesting the above URL. Either GET or POST.
The URL Twilio will request when receiving an incoming SMS message to the sandbox number.
The HTTP method to use when requesting the sms URL. Either GET or POST.
The date that this resource was created, given in RFC 2822 format.
The date that this resource was last updated, given in RFC 2822 format.
The URI for this resource, relative to https://api.twilio.com
